modules.serial_labware.Vacuubrand package¶

Submodules¶

modules.serial_labware.Vacuubrand.Vacuubrand_CVC_3000 module¶

:mod:”Vacuubrand_CVC_3000” – API for Vacuubrand CVC3000 remote controllable vacuum controller¶

  1. 2017 The Cronin Group, University of Glasgow

This provides a python class for Vacuubrand vacuum pumps with CVC 3000 vacuum controller. The command implementation is based on the english manual: English manual version: 999222 / 11/03/2016 Pages 40 - 45

For style guide used see http://xkcd.com/1513/

class modules.serial_labware.Vacuubrand.Vacuubrand_CVC_3000.CVC3000(port=None, device_name=None, connect_on_instantiation=False, soft_fail_for_testing=False)[source]¶

Bases: SerialDevice.serial_labware.SerialDevice

This provides a python class for Vacuubrand vacuum pumps with CVC 3000 vacuum controller. The command implementation is based on the english manual: English manual version: 999222 / 11/03/2016 Pages 40 - 45

end_vacuum_sp¶

Reads the set point (target) for the switch off vacuum in mode Auto :return: call back to send_message with a request to return a value

initialise(controller_version='CVC 3000')[source]¶

Does the necessary setup work. Turns ECHO on, sets the desired controller version and sets the mode to Vac control (in order to always start from the same spot). :param controller_version: desired controller version (“CVC 2000” or “CVC 3000”)

query_status()[source]¶

Queries the status of the pump. For individual parameters see manual p. 43 :return: dictionary of status items

runtime_sp¶

Reads the set point (target) for the run time in mode Auto :return: call back to send_message with a request to return a value

set_mode(mode)[source]¶

Sets the mode of the vacuum controller. :param mode: (string) the mode to be set. Must be a valid key in the MODES_3 dict. :return: call back to __send_message with an order to set the mode

speed_sp¶

Reads the set point (target) for the speed.

Returns:call back to send_message with a request to return a value
start()[source]¶

Starts the current function. :return: True if pump responds properly, else a ValueError is raised.

stop(stop_mode=None)[source]¶

Stops the current function. This does not utilise the different stop parameters, but they seem to serve no apparent purpose anyway. :return: True if pump responds properly, else a ValueError is raised.

vacuum_pv()[source]¶

Reads the process value (actual pressure) for the vacuum in any mode :return: call back to send_message with a request to return a value

vacuum_sp¶

Reads the set point (target) for the vacuum in mode Vac control :return: call back to send_message with a request to return a value

vent(vent_status=1)[source]¶

Controls the vent valve. :param vent_status: 0: valve closed; 1: valve open; 2: vent to atmospheric pressure :return: True if pump responds properly, else a ValueError is raised.
